intro: Conyza extensa, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It features slender, branched stems that can grow up to 1 meter in height, often with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers with white ray florets, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Conyza extensa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
